activities.title: I Will Survive
activities.instructions:
After reading the article, answer the following questions in your journal:

1. In an apocalypse situation, which team member are you?
2. Would York International be a good location for your team to use as a rendezvous site?
3. What will you need to bring with you into the zombie apocalypse?
4. Why is humanity important?

activities.title: Homemade Zombie Slime
activities.instructions: Use this simple recipe to make your own Zombie Slime! You can add green food coloring for Zombies, Red for blood red slime, or pink for Zombie Brain Slime :)

activities.title: Zombie Multiplication
activities.instructions:
Play Zombie Multiplication - Unlock One Level called The Hillside in the cemetery to complete this task!

You will need to correctly answer 25 questions to move on.

activities.title: Outrunning the Zombies!
activities.instructions:
Use the Jump Rope provided in your kit - Time how long you can jump without stopping!  Write your time in your notebook.

After you have one trial completed - see if you can beat your time later this week!

activities.title: Zombie Launcher
activities.instructions: Play Zombie Launcher to test your physics skills- Record your High Score in your journal!

activities.title: Zombie Mad Libs
activities.instructions: Call a friend and ask them to help you complete the Mad Lib in the link below. Glue your completed mad lib in your journal.

activities.title: Zombie Hideout Scavenger Hunt
activities.description: How well do you know your Colorado Geography?
activities.instructions: Use these clues to discover one of the best Zombie hideouts in Colorado. Write the answer in your journal and describe what you know about this location!

activities.title: Zombie Survival Rules
activities.description: Writing a List of Rules to Survive By
activities.instructions: Based on all you have learned this week - create a list of rules we should follow for surviving the Zombie Apocalypse! Glue or copy your list into your journal.

activities.title: Zombie Genetics
activities.description: What will your zombie look like?
activities.instructions: Create your own zombie character by rolling the ‘genetic’ dice. When you're done, draw your zombie in your journal! The directions are linked below:

activities.title: Unlock the Morgue
activities.instructions:
You have a choice…

If you need practice, continue to work on Zombie Multiplication by unlocking The Morgue

If you are more of a Mathematical Genius try the Pre-Algebra Spider Game

Record your score in your journal for Week 2!!

activities.title: Literature Scavenger Hunt
activities.instructions: Read a chapter from a book - any book you find interesting. If you are not currently reading a book pick a new one! Answer the questions in the link in your journal for Week 2!

activities.title: Zombies Around the World
activities.instructions:
Use Google Earth to find each of the following famous landmarks. Once you find it type in where the landmark is located,  what it is (ex: natural landmark, church, ancient ruin etc.) explore the site from all angles in 3-D view

Then answer the Where in The World questions in your notebook for Week 2!

activities.title: Do Zombies Laugh?
activities.instructions:
This is your chance to get creative. Either search the web or draw your own Zombie MEME or Comic Strip. You may work digitally or with paper and pencil - grab a marker to add some color!! You can do this in your notebook or wherever you feel comfortable.
(Bonus points if it tells a story)

activities.title: Monster Maker
activities.instructions:
Read the Monster Story. At the end of the reading, there is a decoder game. In order to complete the game online use this link: Monster Decoder Game.

Write the decoded message in your notebook and draw the monster.

Note: If you are colorblind, click on the eyeball at the top left of the monster maker that will change the game to symbols.

activities.title: In the Dead of Night
activities.instructions: Call a friend and ask them to help you complete the Mad Lib - the funnier the better! Glue or copy your completed Madlib in your notebook.

activities.title: Survivors Ice Cream
activities.description: I scream, you scream, we all scream for ICE CREAM!
activities.instructions: After your heroic escape, celebrate with a bag of Homemade Ice Cream!

activities.title: Zombie Starfish
activities.instructions:
Watch the video  ZOMBIE STARFISH 

The video is a little over 5 minutes long.

After you watch the video, predict what will happen next in your journal using the questions below:

activities.title: Zombie Character Creation
activities.instructions: In your journal use these questions to develop the Zombie you created in last week’s Zombie Genetics activity into a complete character!

activities.title: Zombie Escape!
activities.instructions: Zombies have invaded Colorado and have also made the road impassable - read the Governor's orders to figure out how to escape Colorado’s Zombie Invasion! Use the maps below to help you.

activities.title: Unlock the Stream
activities.instructions:
You have a choice…

If you need practice, continue to work on Zombie Multiplication by unlocking The Stream

If you are more of a Mathematical Genius try the Algebra Puzzle

Record your score in your journal for Week 3!!

activities.title: Reading Between Zombie Attacks
activities.instructions:
Read any book of your choice for 20 minutes.

Once you read for 20 minutes, answer the Google Form questions in your journal for Week 3!

activities.title: Survival Cooking
activities.instructions: You still need to eat when you are on the run from zombies. Below are the materials and steps needed to make food with the sun’s energy:

activities.title: Zombie Description
activities.instructions:
In your journal, brainstorm as many ADJECTIVES as you can to describe Zombies.

Remember an adjective is a describing word...

activities.title: Zombie Workout
activities.instructions: When the Zombies invade you have to be faster and sharper than your best friend and your little brother. Use this workout to get into Escape Shape!

activities.title: Zombie Deer
activities.instructions:
After reading the article, answer the following questions in your journal:

1. What is a chronic wasting disease?
2. How many states now have the chronic wasting disease?
3. Why is chronic wasting disease nicknamed "zombie" deer disease?
4. Which quote from the article best describes why Colorado state officials are trying to conteol the "Zombie" deer disease?

activities.title: Brain Damage
activities.instructions:
As a scientist you have to try to stop the spread of the Zombie Apocalypse. In order to stop it, you first have to identify the exact cause.

Use the information from the videos and any other research you care to include to make an argument for which part of the brain is damaged by a Zombie virus.  Think about the Zombie behavior and include reasons in your argument.  Write your argument n your journal.

activities.title: Independent Reading
activities.instructions:
Read a chapter in the book you are currently reading. Once you have read a chapter or two, answer these questions in your journal:

1. One Sentence Summary: Write a summary for the chapter you just read (Somebody did something because...)

2. Think about the protagonist in the book you are reading. If the main character went to York, would you be friends with them? Be sure to include why or why not!

activities.title: Unlock the Forest
activities.instructions: If you need practice, continue to work on Zombie Multiplication by unlocking The Forest…

activities.title: Steering Science
activities.instructions: If you are forced to leave your location because of a zombie attack, you can make a compass to lead the way. Staying alive depends on finding your way back to home base! This activity shows you how to make a compass with household materials.

activities.title: To Kill a Zombie
activities.instructions: Go back and look at the Zombie you created in the Zombie Genetics Activity from Week Two. What would you do if this was the Zombie sent to attack you in the Zombie Apocalypse? In your journal, write detailed instructions for how to kill your Zombie!

activities.title: Legends of Learning
activities.instructions:
Play the game of your Choice on  Legends of Learning


If you did not use this last year, you may need to create an account. You will use it again for Math class next year.

activities.title: Out of Sight
activities.instructions: Look at a map of Thornton, Colorado. Decide on the best place to hide during the zombie apocalypse. Draw a map or write directions in your journal to get there from your home. Remember you want to stay out of sight.

activities.title: Zombie Outbreak
activities.instructions: Track a Zombie Outbreak in YOUR neighborhood!! Click the link below to create a map of your neighborhood and simulate a Zombie Outbreak! Write in your journal about how fast the Zombie Virus spread in Thornton!

activities.title: Zombie Fitness
activities.instructions: Complete The 8 Best Exercises for the Zombie Apocalypse Workout

activities.title: Don't Drink the Water
activities.instructions: Research three different ways to disinfect contaminated water when you are on the run. List the three different ways and then write the instructions for the best one in your journal.

activities.title: Hidden in Plain Sight
activities.instructions: You know what they say - "If you can’t beat them, Join them!" One way to beat the Zombies is to hide among them. Put together a zombie costume and take pictures!! Use your journal to brainstorm what you will need to make the best zombie disguise

activities.title: Unlock the Plains
activities.instructions: Keep practicing that multiplication! Unlock the Plains

activities.title: Zombie Sweet Tooth
activities.instructions:
Even on the run you may have a sweet tooth to satisfy...
Follow the instructions in the link to make Rock Candy... Draw your best crystals in your journal!

activities.title: Zombie Poetry
activities.instructions:
Check out the poem below titled Digital Zombies 
Then choose ….

Write your own using the published poem as a model.

Or

Write a response to the author.

activities.title: Legends of Learning
activities.instructions:
Play the game of your Choice on  Legends of Learning


If you did not use this last year, you may need to create an account. You will use it again for Math class next year.

activities.title: Zombies are Real
activities.instructions: After reading the article, “Zombies are Real,” close your eyes and picture a zombie insect!  In your journal, draw what you just pictured and write 2-3 sentences describing your zombie insect.

activities.title: Survive the Apocalypse
activities.instructions: One day, you wake up to hear the news: the zombie apocalypse has started! In order to survive, you and your friends must find the correct path of zombie-free safe zones throughout the world. Good luck, and remember to not get bitten!

activities.title: Practice in the Cemetery
activities.instructions: Keep practicing your multiplication - See how fast you can move through the cemetery!!

activities.title: History of Zombies
activities.instructions: Almost everyone is familiar with the modern zombie: a shuffling, ravenous, reanimated corpse that terrorizes and eats humans. But since zombies aren’t real, how did their legend get started? Where did the word “zombie” come from?

activities.title: Legends of Learning
activities.instructions:
Play the game of your Choice on  Legends of Learning


If you did not use this last year, you may need to create an account. You will use it again for Math class next year.

activities.title: Zombie Pandemic
activities.instructions:
Read Part 1 of the graphic novel, Zombie Pandemic, and then choose one of the following activities.

1. Pay close attention to what Todd, Julie, and Max do while you are reading. Then, based on their actions, come up with a list of the ten most important items to have in case of a zombie pandemic.

2. The story ends with “to be continued” and leaves your imagination to come up with the ending.  So, how would you end the story?  What happens to Todd, Julie, and Max?

activities.title: Zombie Butler
activities.instructions: With a friend or family member, Complete Quints Guide to getting a Zombie Butler. Write it in your journal!

activities.title: Human Electricity Conductor
activities.instructions: During a zombie apocalypse, it is quite possible that your electricity would go out!  OH NO!!  Now, you have to figure out a way to create some light.  Follow the link below and learn how to turn on a lightbulb using only a balloon and yourself!
